existing_features.title: Create a responsive single-page Valentine/Rose Day website that clearly depicts “Rose Day on 7th Feb” with a soft reddish-pink background and a romantic, cute aesthetic.
Add a main hero section featuring a chibi-style boy holding a pink rose for his girlfriend, presented as the central visual element of the page.
Implement a coherent visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) consistent across the page, using a distinct Valentine/Rose Day style (avoid a blue/purple palette).
Add the generated image assets to the frontend as static files under `frontend/public/assets/generated` and render them directly from the frontend (do not proxy through the backend).

Add a short greeting message to the Rose Day page (English user-facing text) in a prominent, visually consistent position (e.g., in the header area near the title/date) without disrupting the existing layout.

Update the hero chibi boy image so it is full color (not black-and-white) and its background/blending matches the website background (no visible mismatched box/background behind the character). Update the page to use the corrected asset.
Update the website typography by switching to a new, cohesive font set (body/sans, display/headings, and script/accent) and apply it consistently across the Rose Day single-page site.

Update the hero chibi boy illustration so the character holds a bunch of roses in one hand and a Dairy Milk chocolate bar in the other, keeping the illustration full-color and with a clean transparent/background-blended cutout consistent with the existing page style. Update the Rose Day page to use the new/updated asset and adjust the image alt text accordingly (English).

Update the Rose Day page header greeting text to use exactly the user-provided message (including line breaks and emoji) in a prominent, visually consistent position near the title/date without disrupting the existing layout.
Adjust the Rose Day theme text color tokens so on-page text appears more visible and shifts toward a lighter whitish-pink while preserving the existing romantic red/pink palette.
Ensure the most prominent text elements on the Rose Day page use the updated, more-visible whitish-pink text styling consistently.

Update the Rose Day theme text color tokens to use a stronger, more saturated pink for primary readable text (not a near-white tint), so the on-page copy is clearly visible against the current red/pink background and gradient overlays.

Ensure the most prominent text elements on the Rose Day page use the updated stronger-pink readable text styling consistently, including the header greeting, date, subtitle, message card body text, and footer text.
